page.title: 10Farming
page.content: The remainder of the LINDEAN area is completely occupied by three farms in the category "Livestock _ with _ arable" and half _ a _ dozen small enterprises including individual fields used for grazing cattle, sheep and horses. A description of one of the farms will serve to illustrate the range of activities of all three. It extends to 560 acres and lies between 100 and 270 metres above sea level. In 1985 roughly 150 acres are in crop: barley (100), oats and turnips(20/25 each). The remaining acres are in grass _ rotational or permanent. 500 haif-bred ewes are mated with either suffolk or texel rams and it is aimed to sell 20/25% of the resultant lambs in the fat market and the remainder as "stores". 70/100 bullocks}are sold annually-Hereford and Angus.There are two tractormen & one shepherd employed
